summary: Shitpost of the day
body:
Shitpost of the day

Does Hogwarts’s library use a numerical call number like the Dewey decimal system? Or is it just by author in each various subject? If it does, how do they assign numbers to each subject? Is it standard in wizarding library’s around the world or did the founders just go “fuck it” and make up their own system?

I have questions

Ron: We did well
Harry: Can you both shut up?

blog.name: 12dancingwizards
blog.title: Sirius Black Is Gay
blog.description:
Jk Rowling who? Idk her.

All the characters are now queer poc and anyone who disagrees can fight me. I’m here for positivity about all the houses and running Snape over with my truck. Asks, messages, and submissions are super welcome!! I wanna interact with my followers!

Mod is a lesbian nonbinary slytherin if you were wondering. They/them pronouns please!

Also this is a sideblog. Main is @glitch-h Icon credit: @alessiajontrunfio

tags: i had feelings abt my boy ...
summary:
Of course Sirius Black laughed in the middle of the street surrounded by the bodies of muggles
In that instant he’d truly lost...
body:
Of course Sirius Black laughed in the middle of the street surrounded by the bodies of muggles

In that instant he’d truly lost everything. His best friends had been murdered by their other best friend, his godson was an orphan, and he’d been deprived of the revenge he so desperately sought. And he realized that he’d packaged himself nice and pretty as Pettigrew’s alibi; no one would believe that he had not been James’ secret keeper, and there he was, the only other one who held the truth gone and a street blown up.

It was a lot for anyone to handle in one night

So he laughed, and he laughed, and he laughed, and if he looked deranged, it’s because he was. Just not for the reason people thought.

His friends were dead, Remus would never forgive him, and he was to blame.

It was a lot for anyone to handle in one night

So he laughed, and he laughed, and he laughed, and if he looked deranged, it’s because he was. Just not for the reason people thought.

His friends were dead, Remus would never forgive him, and he was to blame.

And he realized that he’d packaged himself nice and pretty as Pettigrew’s alibi; no one would believe that he had not been James’ secret keeper, and there he was, the only other one who held the truth gone and a street blown up.

It was a lot for anyone to handle in one night

So he laughed, and he laughed, and he laughed, and if he looked deranged, it’s because he was. Just not for the reason people thought.

His friends were dead, Remus would never forgive him, and he was to blame.

In that instant he’d truly lost everything. His best friends had been murdered by their other best friend, his godson was an orphan, and he’d been deprived of the revenge he so desperately sought. And he realized that he’d packaged himself nice and pretty as Pettigrew’s alibi; no one would believe that he had not been James’ secret keeper, and there he was, the only other one who held the truth gone and a street blown up.

So he laughed, and he laughed, and he laughed, and if he looked deranged, it’s because he was. Just not for the reason people thought.
